alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:20PM EDT until July 10 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT MONDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following counties...Hunterdon, Morris, Somerset, and Warren. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 818 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding on numerous local roadways. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hackettstown, Washington, Flemington, High Bridge, Clinton, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Hope, Glen Gardner, Hampton, and Frenchtown. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 12 and 28. Interstate 80 in New Jersey near mile marker 12. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
